entry.title: DataPoint PropertyValue Property="ReferenceValue" not displayed
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I built an Overviewpage ( OVP ) app with an analytical card in VisualStudioCode. I added Datapoint with TrendCalculation. In VSCode runs it right. 

the target is being displayed, as you can see here:

 

But, after deplying to the backend ( S4 on demand ) the value is not being displayed. 

as you can see here: 

 

sapui versions are both the same: 1.120.30. There are no other changes.

There is no difference wether value is pulled from odata or hardcodiert:

                                <PropertyValue Property="TrendCalculation">
                                    <Record Type="UI.TrendCalculationType">
                                        <PropertyValue Property="ReferenceValue" Path="Goal"/>
                                        <PropertyValue Property="IsRelativeDifference" Bool="true"/>
                                        <PropertyValue Property="UpDifference" Decimal="1"/>
                                        <PropertyValue Property="StrongUpDifference" Decimal="2"/>
                                        <PropertyValue Property="DownDifference" Decimal="-1"/>
                                        <PropertyValue Property="StrongDownDifference" Decimal="-2"/>
                                    </Record>
                                </PropertyValue>

 

makes no difference:

                                <PropertyValue Property="TrendCalculation">
                                    <Record Type="UI.TrendCalculationType">
                                        <PropertyValue Property="ReferenceValue" String="90"/>
                                        <PropertyValue Property="IsRelativeDifference" Bool="true"/>
                                        <PropertyValue Property="UpDifference" Decimal="1"/>
                                        <PropertyValue Property="StrongUpDifference" Decimal="2"/>
                                        <PropertyValue Property="DownDifference" Decimal="-1"/>
                                        <PropertyValue Property="StrongDownDifference" Decimal="-2"/>
                                    </Record>
                                </PropertyValue>

if I analyse the field in the UI5 here is VSCode / local:

 

and here backend: 

 

no matter if with odata or hardcodiert, the field formatted is in the backend empty and local is filled with a value. that is what is being displayed.  I am stuck.

please help!

Regards

Jarda

entry.title: Fiori Elements Extensions – When to use controller extensions vs. handlers?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m currently working with Fiori elements applications and I’m trying to better understand the usage extensibility options:

  • controller extensions

  • event/extension handlers

What I think I understand so far:

  • controller extensions seem to be more related to page lifecycle (onInit, onBeforeRendering, etc.) and manipulating generated controls

  • handlers seem to be more related to user actions or specific control events (button press, validation, value help, etc.)

But there are still situations where the border is blurry for me.

I’m not just looking for definitions from documentation, but for experience-based explanations, examples, and best practices from people who use Fiori elements extensions in real projects.

Thanks in advance for any insights,

Mikolaj

entry.title: Custom fields added to extended SEGW OData entity not available in metadata
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

In Fiori App ID: F0843 (Post Goods Receipt for Purchasing Document), we are trying to add some custom fields in entity GR4PO_DL_Item of OData service MMIM_GR4PO_DL_SRV by redefinition and importing properties that are already available as an .include in the line item type MMIM_GR4PO_DL_ITEM.

After this we redefined "Define" method of MPC_EXT class with code:

  METHOD define.

  super->define( ).

  DATA(lo_entity_type) = model->get_entity_type( iv_entity_name = 'GR4PO_DL_Item' ).

  " Expand the specific include structure to expose its fields
  lo_entity_type->add_auto_expand_include(
    EXPORTING
      iv_include_name     = 'MMIM_GR4PO_DL_ITEM'
      iv_bind_conversions = abap_true
  ).
ENDMETHOD.

We followed the same approach as shown in this learning journey:

https://learning.sap.com/courses/building-odata-services-with-sap-gateway/redefining-an-sap-gateway-service

We already generated the Runtime objects and there seems to be no error as metadata loading properly. However, in the metadata the custom fields are not available and we are not sure what could be missing. The metadata does show the all the inlcudes but does not show the fields added to include, even though they are available in extended entity type.

Did someone face similar situation and can help in finding the solution?

entry.title: How to make standard Fiori apps open an extended Fiori app instead of the standard one?
entry.content:
Hello experts, good morning.

I would like to ask for your guidance regarding an issue we are facing while extending a standard Fiori application.

Context:
We were asked to extend a standard app in order to adjust a specific parameter within it. To achieve this, we used a SAPUI5 Adaptation Project from SAP Business Application Studio (BAS).

The required adjustments were successfully implemented, and the app was deployed correctly to our system. After that, the necessary Catalog, Group, and Role were created so the extended app could be used.

Initially, a custom (Z) Target Mapping was created for the extended app, based on the standard app’s target mapping, and everything was working as expected.

However, we later identified the following issue:

The standard app can be launched from other standard Fiori applications. When this navigation occurs, the standard app is always opened, but our requirement is for the extended app to be opened instead, so the requested change can be used.

To address this, we tried modifying the Target Mapping, keeping the same semantic object (or at least the same name), and removing the original target mapping, so that the apps performing the navigation would open the extended app.

This approach worked partially. For some users, the navigation opens the extended app correctly. However, when testing with other users who have more roles and profiles assigned, the system still opens the standard app instead of the extended one.

Additionally, we tried using the “Add SAP Fiori Launchpad Config” option available in SAP BAS:

However, this option does not seem to work, may be deprecated, or not supported in our system, as we receive a “URL Not Found” error.

In summary, my main question is:

How can I make standard Fiori applications open the extended app instead of the standard one?

We have already tried adjusting the target mapping and exploring Launchpad configurations, but without complete success. At this point, we have run out of ideas and would really appreciate any guidance.

Do you know of any alternative approach, recommended solution, or documentation that could help in this scenario?

Thank you for your time and for reading my question.
I look forward to your comments.

Best regards,
EBZ

entry.title: Looking for Expert and Community Insights on My SAP Technical Journey
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I hope you are all doing well.

I would like to kindly ask for your feedback and professional insights regarding my current learning journey within the SAP Technical domain. My goal is to continuously improve my technical profile and ensure that my learning path aligns well with real-world SAP projects and current market expectations.

Below is a brief overview of my learning direction and the reasoning behind each focus area.


SAP Technical Learning Direction At this stage, my primary focus is on pursuing the SAP Technical track. I am currently concentrating on SAP Basis, aiming to build a strong and solid foundation in SAP system administration, core architecture, and operational concepts.
In parallel, I am expanding my knowledge across several complementary technical areas, as outlined below:


SAP HANA
My objective is to gain a clear and comprehensive understanding of SAP HANA database architecture and how SAP systems interact with the database layer in terms of structure, performance optimization, and system integration.


SAP ABAP
I am working on building a solid understanding of the ABAP stack, with a focus on how development processes are designed and implemented within SAP systems. This helps me better understand system logic, debugging, and collaboration with development teams from a technical perspective.


SAP CPI (Cloud Integration)
My focus includes understanding SAP’s transition from traditional on-premise environments to cloud-based platforms, along with cloud integration concepts such as internal (A2A) and external (B2B) integration scenarios.

Additionally, I have complemented this learning path with the Apache Camel Framework, due to its importance and relevance within SAP integration solutions.


SAP UI5 / Fiori & SAP BTP CAPM
Recently, SAP introduced important updates related to both frontend and backend development models. I have been exploring these updates and following commonly recommended learning resources to better understand the modern SAP development approach, including CAP-based application development.


Learning Approach
Overall, I am intentionally following a structured and methodical learning sequence to build a holistic understanding of SAP Architecture as an integrated enterprise platform, rather than focusing on individual tools or isolated technologies.


Current Learning Path & Courses
Below are the main courses I am currently following (via Udemy):

SAP NetWeaver Fundamentals

SAP Basis Administration

SAP HANA Administration

Apache Camel Framework with Spring Boot

SAP Cloud Integration (CI / CPI), including API Management and Event Mesh

SAP UI5 / Fiori Full Stack with TypeScript / JavaScript using SAP BTP RAPM / CAPM


I would truly appreciate your feedback on whether this learning path is well-structured and aligned with real-world SAP implementations, and whether there are any key areas you would recommend adding, adjusting, or prioritizing differently.

Thank you in advance for your time and valuable insights.

Best regards,

entry.title: Define routes of managed app router to ui5 freestyle landing page
entry.content:
Hi everyone

I have a fullstack cap application with a managed approuter that will be used to route to multiple apps within my larger application. Currently I trying to get the approuter to route to a custom ui5 freestyle app (essentially custom tiles) that will be used to launch each of my required applications. However, the current approuter routes results in the following error: 

Cannot GET /baseui/webapp/index.html

Please note that my folder structure is as follows, with my freestyle ui5 app sitting under baseui>webapp>view>homeview.xml. My app router was generated automatically under the app folder. Can someone please highlight the mistakes I am making?

 

 

my approuter xs-app.json is as follows:

{
  "welcomeFile": "/baseui/webapp/index.html",
  "authenticationMethod": "route",
  "routes": [
    {
      "source": "^/(.*)$",
      "target": "$1",
      "destination": "srv-api",
      "csrfProtection": true,
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa"
    }
  ]
}

 manifest.json

{
  "_version": "1.81.0",
  "sap.app": {
    "id": "baseui",
    "type": "application",
    "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties",
    "applicationVersion": {
      "version": "0.0.1"
    },
    "title": "{{appTitle}}",
    "description": "{{appDescription}}",
    "resources": "resources.json",
    "sourceTemplate": {
      "id": "@sap/generator-fiori:basic",
      "version": "1.20.1",
      "toolsId": "af291ae3-1402-4deb-b9bf-bb8ba11270ea"
    },
    "dataSources": {
      "mainService": {
        "uri": "/odata/v4/employee-central/",
        "type": "OData",
        "settings": {
          "annotations": [],
          "odataVersion": "4.0"
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "sap.ui": {
    "technology": "UI5",
    "icons": {
      "icon": "",
      "favIcon": "",
      "phone": "",
      "phone@2": "",
      "tablet": "",
      "tablet@2": ""
    },
    "deviceTypes": {
      "desktop": true,
      "tablet": true,
      "phone": true
    }
  },
  "sap.ui5": {
    "flexEnabled": true,
    "dependencies": {
      "minUI5Version": "1.144.0",
      "libs": {
        "sap.m": {},
        "sap.ui.core": {}
      }
    },
    "contentDensities": {
      "compact": true,
      "cozy": true
    },
    "models": {
      "i18n": {
        "type": "sap.ui.model.resource.ResourceModel",
        "settings": {
          "bundleName": "baseui.i18n.i18n"
        }
      },
      "": {
        "dataSource": "mainService",
        "preload": true,
        "settings": {
          "operationMode": "Server",
          "autoExpandSelect": true,
          "earlyRequests": true
        }
      }
    },
    "resources": {
      "css": [
        {
          "uri": "css/style.css"
        }
      ]
    },
    "routing": {
      "config": {
        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",
        "controlAggregation": "pages",
        "controlId": "app",
        "transition": "slide",
        "type": "View",
        "viewType": "XML",
        "path": "baseui.view",
        "async": true,
        "viewPath": "baseui.view"
      },
      "routes": [
        {
          "name": "Routehome",
          "pattern": ":?query:",
          "target": [
            "Targethome"
          ]
        }
      ],
      "targets": {
        "Targethome": {
          "id": "home",
          "name": "home"
        }
      }
    },
    "rootView": {
      "viewName": "baseui.view.App",
      "type": "XML",
      "id": "App",
      "async": true
    }
  }
}

 mta.yaml 

_schema-version: 3.3.0
ID: basecap
description: A simple CAP project.
version: 1.0.0
modules:
- name: basecap-srv
  type: nodejs
  path: gen/srv
  requires:
  - name: basecap-auth
  - name: basecap-destination
  provides:
  - name: srv-api
    properties:
      srv-url: ${default-url}
  parameters:
    buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
    instances: 1
  build-parameters:
    builder: npm-ci
- name: basecap
  type: approuter.nodejs
  path: app/router
  requires:
  - name: srv-api
    group: destinations
    properties:
      forwardAuthToken: true
      name: srv-api
      url: ~{srv-url}
  - name: basecap-auth
  - name: basecap-destination
  provides:
  - name: app-api
    properties:
      app-protocol: ${protocol}
      app-uri: ${default-uri}
  parameters:
    disk-quota: 256M
    keep-existing-routes: true
    memory: 256M
- name: basecap-app-content
  type: com.sap.application.content
  path: .
  requires:
  - name: basecap-repo-host
    parameters:
      content-target: true
  build-parameters:
    build-result: resources
    requires:
    - artifacts:
      - baseui.zip
      name: baseui
      target-path: resources/
- name: baseui
  type: html5
  path: app/baseui
  build-parameters:
    build-result: dist
    builder: custom
    commands:
    - npm install
    - npm run build:cf
    supported-platforms: []
resources:
- name: basecap-auth
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    config:
      oauth2-configuration:
        credential-types:
        - binding-secret
        - x509
        redirect-uris:
        - https://*~{app-api/app-uri}/**
      tenant-mode: dedicated
      xsappname: basecap-xsuaa
      #xsappname: basecap-${org}-${space}
    path: ./xs-security.json
    service: xsuaa
    service-plan: application
  requires:
  - name: app-api
- name: basecap-destination
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    config:
      HTML5Runtime_enabled: false
      init_data:
        instance:
          destinations:
          - Authentication: NoAuthentication
            Name: ui5
            ProxyType: Internet
            Type: HTTP
            URL: https://ui5.sap.com
          existing_destinations_policy: update
    service: destination
    service-plan: lite
- name: basecap-repo-host
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    service: html5-apps-repo
    service-name: basecap-html5-service
    service-plan: app-host
parameters:
  deploy_mode: html5-repo
  enable-parallel-deployments: true
build-parameters:
  before-all:
  - builder: custom
    commands:
    - npm ci
    - npx cds build --production

entry.title: Attachement is attached in the Fiori My Inbox, and I want to view the attachemnt in SAP or Fiori
entry.content:
Attachment is attached in the Fiori My Inbox, and I want to view the attachment in SAP or Fiori, But I could not view the Attached Document, Please provide me the solution.


--- Steps to Reproduce ---

1. PR should created from Fiori
2. After Create a PR, Go to My Inbox for Approve.
3. In My Inbox select -> show Details in Right side        bottom -> and Select the Attachment.
4. Select the Attachment for the Upload and after Upload Approver will Approve the PR.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Defaulting filter value using user defaults for a custom sapui5 app
entry.content:
Hi All,
I have developed a custom EWM app, where I want to use user defaulted value for warehouse field in my app. I have setup user defaults on the launchpad and saved it. Also, I have used parameter in the tile and target mapping under /ui2/flpd_cust (Designer), but it is not working.

Target mapping config:

Tile Config:

Screen flow:

For my custom app, when i click on the main screen, it navigates to a KPI tile screen with multiple KPI tiles and on selecting on any of the tiles, it lands to an OVP app, that contains the warehouse filter (which I want to fetch from user defaults). 
Main tile -> KPI Tile screen (without filters) -> Overview page with filters.

Any help here, will be rewarded.

References:
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/setting-user-defaults-in-sap-s-4hana/ba-p/13341475

entry.title: How to find the Business Context of an application without documentation?
entry.content:
I am working on S/4HANA 2023 FPS02 (Private Cloud). I am trying to extend the app Manage Journal Entries (F0717) by adding custom fields to the "Line Items" section of the Journal Entry Item.

Fiori Apps Library Limitations: The "Extensibility" section for F0717 only mentions SAPUI5 Adaptation Projects, but does not list the underlying Backend Business Contexts for data model extension.

What is the formal technical procedure to identify which Business Context maps to a specific section of a Fiori App?

Is there a technical way to find the required Business Context by inspecting the OData Service?

entry.title: “SAP Fiori Overview and Implementation Guidelines for Functional Consultants”
entry.content:
What is SAP Fiori in S/4HANA?

SAP Fiori is a comprehensive suite of role-based applications designed to deliver a simple, intuitive, and consistent user experience across SAP systems.

It provides transactional, analytical, and fact sheet–based applications that allow users to perform business activities efficiently on desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.

 

 

 

Key Benefits of SAP Fiori

  • Intuitive and user-friendly interface
  • Task-based, simplified design to improve productivity
  • Faster processing with minimal training effort
  • Line-item–based operational reporting for better visibility
  • Unified access to SAP GUI transactions and modern apps through a single Fiori Launchpad

 

 

 

Why Focus on User Experience (UX)?

SAP Fiori enhances:

  • User adoption through simplified screens
  • Operational efficiency by reducing clicks and processing time
  • Decision-making with real-time insights
  • Mobility, enabling users to work anytime, anywhere

 

 

 

A better user experience directly improves business performance and user satisfaction.

Types of SAP Fiori Applications

 

 

  1. Transactional Apps (Blue)
  • Used for creating, updating, and processing business data
  • Support daily business operations
  • Examples:
    • Create Purchase Order
    • Approve Leave Request
    • Post Goods Receipt
  1. Analytical Apps (Green)
  • Used for reporting and analytics
  • Provide KPIs, charts, and real-time insights
  • Help management monitor performance and trends
  1. Fact Sheet Apps (Orange)
  • Display detailed contextual information
  • Show related business data in one place
  • Examples:
    • Customer details
    • Material information
    • Vendor overview

 

SAP Fiori Launchpad

The SAP Fiori Launchpad acts as a central entry point that provides:

  • Access to Fiori apps and SAP GUI transactions
  • Role-based tiles
  • Personalized user experience
  • Integration of classic and modern SAP applications

 

 

 

Empowering Functional Consultants with SAP Fiori Knowledge

  1. Confirm Business Requirements

Identify all required:

  • Transactional apps
  • Analytical apps
  • Fact sheet apps

based on business needs.

  1. Refer to SAP Fiori Apps Library

Access the official SAP repository:

🔗 https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com

Use this to:

  • Search for relevant apps
  • Check app type and functionality
  • View technical and implementation details

 

  1. Validate System Compatibility

Ensure the required Fiori apps are:

  • Supported for the current SAP version
  • Compatible with S/4HANA (On-Premise or Cloud)

 

  1. Ensure Application Activation

After validation:

  • Confirm required apps are activated by Basis/Fiori team
  • Follow configuration details mentioned in the Fiori Library
  • Refer to Implementation Information section for each app

 

 

  1. Verify Role Assignment

Ensure:

  • Appropriate business roles are assigned to the user
  • Roles match the configuration mentioned in the Fiori Library
  • Only then will the Fiori tiles be visible in the launchpad

(Role mapping is usually handled by the Security team)

 

 

  1. Confirm OData Service Authorization
  • Validate required OData services are activated
  • Ensure OData roles are assigned to the user
  • OData details can be found in the Implementation Information section of each app in the Fiori Library
  • Required for backend data access and app functionality

 

 

After completing all configuration and authorization steps, ensure that the respective Fiori applications are thoroughly tested and working correctly in the Development, Test, and Pre-QA systems before requesting business users to perform UAT.

entry.title: Pattern
entry.content:

I am trying to find an iOS pattern where the top navigation bar has a drop-down to navigate between pages. Could you please point me to the right resource for the same.
